reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project is addressed to women from rural areas in a disadvantageous situation who are the potential victims of trafficking and other forms of discrimination. Project scope is to impact the Soroca District rural community welfare and common responsibili ty in community development.Specific objectives:1. Improve poor families living conditions by developing self-sustaining businesses that have the capacity to outlast the project's completion.2. Having independent peer cooperation among women entrepreneurs with the purpose of strengthening their overall participation in the life of their communities.3. Improved understanding regarding common responsibility in community development in order to contribute directly to the community?s cohesion and prosperity.The project is addressed to women in order to promote gender equality which will have an impact on the population in rural and remote areas promoting cohesion and prosperity especially among youth and elders supporting an inclusive society and active aging. I t also will develop an ecological business environment in order to insure (based on Soarta Association specific procedures) environmental protection animal welfare selective collection of waste recycling and the appropriate moderate use of material resourc es.Target group: 35 people of all ages who live below the poverty line 50% of whom are women from the rural areas of Soroca District.Project Activities:1. Project Management.2. Organizing Women Entrepreneurs Network (WEN) as a peer group.3. The improvement of common responsibility in community development.
